snippet: Throwing up a major roadblock to California Indian tribes' efforts to build a  rival gambling empire to Las Vegas, the state Supreme Court today overturned a ballot measure that would have allowed expansion of legalized gambling on Indian land.   ...
lead_paragraph: Throwing up a major roadblock to California Indian tribes' efforts to build a rival gambling empire to Las Vegas, the state Supreme Court today overturned a ballot measure that would have allowed expansion of legalized gambling on Indian land. The court ruled that the measure violated the state Constitution's ban on Nevada-style casinos.
abstract: California Supreme Court, in 6-1 ruling, overturns ballot measure allowing legalized gambling on Indian land, throwing up major roadblock to efforts by state's Indian tribes to build gambling empire to rival Las Vegas; rules measure violates state Constitution's ban on Nevada-style casinos; raises prospect that at least some of lucrative casinos that sprouted around state before issue was settled may be shut down; efforts of Federal authorities to close at least 10 illegal casinos and new efforts of Indian tribes to amend state Constitution to allow casino gambling discussed; photo (M)

headline.main: Ruling in California Crimps Indian Plans For a Casino Empire
